name: Messari
title: Markus Levin (Co-Founder, XYO) | Fully Diluted with Messari Research | Unqualified Opinions
text:
Synopsis
XYO is a decentralized data verification platform that has successfully built a sustainable business model by creating a large network of non-crypto users who generate location and IoT data, with a focus on proof of location and proof of origin technologies.

Key Insights
- XYO has grown to over 8 million network nodes globally, with 80% of users being non-crypto individuals like drivers and runners
- The company generated $10.5 million in revenue in 2023, with most revenue coming from web2 clients
- XYO is preparing to launch its own Layer 1 blockchain in the current quarter, designed to be data-centric and more cost-efficient for data storage
- The platform has a Coinbase integration that allows users to easily redeem tokens without understanding complex crypto mechanics
- 95% of users redeem their earned points for XYO tokens, effectively onboarding millions into the crypto ecosystem
- The company is exploring partnerships in augmented reality and real-world gaming, leveraging their proof of location technology
- XYO sees potential in providing high-certainty data for AI training, potentially reducing AI hallucinations
- The project has been operational since 2018 and was one of the first crypto companies in the US to be SEC-qualified for a Regulation A offering
